name: allout.vim
description:
Allout files are a handy synoptic (or tree-like) representation of a document.  Such files were originally introduced as a GNU Emacs mode.  Vim offers tools and help for browsing or editing these Allout files.

Once installed, syntax colouring of Allout files should work in standard Vim.  Allout specific commands and mappings require a Python-enabled Vim.
install_details:
Refetch a recent Allout-Vim  from:

    http://fp-etc.progiciels-bpi.ca/showfile.html?mode=archives

When on Unix (or Linux), fech a .tgz archive from above, unpack it and look at README.

If on Windows, fetch a .zip archive from above, move to the directory holding ftplugin/, syntax/, etc. and unpack the archive once there.  For more advice about how to get the Python part of the tool in motion with Vim, visit and read:

    http://fp-etc.progiciels-bpi.ca/showfile.html?name=allout/vim/README

for more detailed installation instructions.
